title: Man, 23, reveals how he makes millions after quitting college to trade online
text:

With just four GCSEs to his name, no-one thought Luke Blackburn would make anything of his life.

He opted out of further education, quit college and was told it would not be easy to find a job.

But at just 23 he's proved all the doubters wrong - in spectacular fashion.

For Luke, who describes himself as a "working class guy from Hull", has made his first million - all from the comfort of his own home.

Watching tutorial videos on YouTube, he taught himself to trade online using Forex, a foreign exchange market.

Now, just six years after quitting the classroom in December 2013, he's enjoying a life of fast cars and holidays every year and owns four luxury watches and three-buy-to-let properties.

And, having a point to prove to those who doubted him, he loves to flaunt his success on social media.

(Image: PIC BY CATERS NEWS)

Luke told Hull Live : "I'm a working class guy from Hull. I'm a pretty down to earth person, I've come from a normal family with normal jobs.

"I've worked hard and as far as I'm concerned I can spend my money on whatever I like.

"I never wanted to worry about paying for anything. I saw how much my mum struggled when we were growing up and I knew I didn't want to do that."

Luke likes to post pictures of himself with sportscars, piles of cash and glasses of champagne. He now lives in Brough and makes up to £50,000 a month.

And now others are flocking to learn his online trading secrets - and they're willing to pay hundreds of pounds for the privilege.

(Image: PIC BY CATERS NEWS)

After dropping out of college he took out a £1,000 loan, transforming his life with sheer will and determination - and a knack for trading.

He started out as an an apprentice at an IT firm - the place where he started on his trading path.

He now rakes in up to £50,000 a month.

Luke said: "A few of my friends traded at the time and I thought 'why not, let's give it a go'.

"As I was trading, people were asking for help and I realised that I could make money that way too. All the while I was still working as an apprentice. I never thought it would take off to what it has done.

"My original goal was just to earn a few extra hundred pounds each month."

(Image: CATERS)

Luke's says growing up his parents struggled for money. He now makes sure they are secure financially and regularly offers to foot bills for them.

"My parents worked very hard to support our three brothers and always gave us whatever we needed," he said.

"My mum always said 'you need to do well' and definitely instilled a strong work ethic in me."

Luke began to trade with his business partner and left his apprenticeship after one year to trade Forex full time.

He has now built a small business empire of rental properties, investments and claims to rake in between £15,000 and £50,000 a month through his trading and teaching business.

He travels across the world on exotic holidays as he only needs a laptop and internet connection in order to carry out his work.

He claims to own three buy-to-let properties, four luxury watches and frequently picks up bills for his parents and other family members.

(Image: PIC BY CATERS NEWS)

He said: "It's a difficult question to answer but once you add all of my assets up, I'm worth about £1,000,000.

"Despite the money though the goal was never to become a millionaire. I just want to be stress free and comfortable. I don't want to worry about bills or anything like that.

"I can work wherever and whenever I want to. I don't need an office. All I need is a laptop and an internet connection."

Luke said his main tip to any wannabe trader is not to get too stressed out when things are going badly. He said: "It's great when things are going well but the crucial thing is how you react when things aren't going the way you planned.

"Don't rush, don't try and have a specific goal, just let it flow and don't put stress on yourself, don't take it too seriously.

"If it happens, it happens, if it doesn't it doesn't."
description: Luke Blackburn has become a millionaire trading Forex - not bad for a 'working class guy from Hull' who lecturers said would not amount to anything
